categories: Category:The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook recipes

nodes.text: Felucian Garden Spread was a vegetarian dish created by Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs. He served it at Tuggs' Grub when stationed at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo in Black Spire Outpost on Batuu in 34 ABY. Another version was published as a recipe in his cookbook, The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook.

Felucian Garden Spread was vegetarian dish that could be prepared from a recipe or eaten at a restaurant. The restaurant version consisted of nysillin relish and herb hummus accompanied by a meat substitute made from the vicious yerdua plant and formed into balls. The ingredients were harvested by Felucian farmers and delivered fresh by Gossam traders. On the side were pieces of flatbread which could be used to scoop up the relish. When the dish followed the recipe, it was composed of vegetable relish, bean hummus, Parwan Nutricakes, and ronto wrappers.

In 34 ABY, the dish was served at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo in Batuu's Black Spire Outpost when the traveling restaurant Tuggs' Grub was stationed there. The restaurant owner and creator of the dish was Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs. Before he worked for Maz Kanata at her castle on Takodana, Tuggs spent time at a farm on Felucia where he learned the Felucian farming and harvesting methods as well as the importance of using fresh and local ingredients in all of his food. He was inspired by the Felucian people and their teachings to create this dish, which he also named after them. Tuggs wrote a cookbook which included his recipe for the dish and its components.

This dish is found in the real world Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo at Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge. It was initially a lunch-only dish, but has since become available at both lunch and dinner. Since its introduction, it has been renamed to "Felucian Kefta & Hummus Garden Spread." The menu's description reads, "Plant-based meatballs, herb hummus, tomato-cucumber relish, pita."

The dish was inspired by the plant-covered planet Felucia, which was described by Brian Piasecki, culinary director for concept development at Walt Disney World Resort, as a "completely green planet" suitable to vegetarian or plant-based diets. According to Piasecki, the kefta plant-based meatballs are made with an Impossible Foods vegan product that has a meat-like taste.

A recipe for the dish was included in the 2019 recipe book Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, written by Marc Sumerak and Chelsea Monroe-Cassel. It incorporates Ronto Wrappers and Parwan Nutricakes, which also have recipes included in the book, or they can be substituted with pita bread and falafel, respectively. They are added to the black bean hummus and tomato-cucumber salad. The hummus, which is topped with the salad, is made with black beans, tahini, minced garlic, olive oil, chopped parsley, lemon juice, oregano, cumin, salt, pepper, and cilantro. The salad is made with diced tomato and cucumber, chopped fresh mint, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
